image.altText: A lawyer with sunglasses outside court

props.synopsis: Zali Burrows's description of Bruce Lehrmann's appeal against last year's defamation ruling neglected that her client was the applicant — and now appellant — in a civil proceeding.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyer forgets key detail: the defamation case was his idea

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann carrying a bag beside a woman dressed in black.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann's bid to overturn a finding that he raped his former colleague Brittany Higgins has not started smoothly, with Federal Court judges questioning the logic of his grounds of appeal.

title.children: 'I don't understand': Logic of Bruce Lehrmann's appeal bid questioned by judges

image.altText: A woman with brown hair in a suit jacket looks serious.

props.synopsis: Over two days, the Federal Court has heard from representatives for Bruce Lehrmann, Network Ten and Lisa Wilkinson as Mr Lehrmann appeals a ruling that he raped Brittany Higgins on the balance of probabilities.

title.children: Appeals court hears Lisa Wilkinson was prepared to interview Bruce Lehrmann - as it happened

image.altText: A man with glasses in a suit holds an umbrella.

props.synopsis: Federal Court judges express frustration with Bruce Lehrmann's lawyer as his appeal over his failed defamation case wraps up.

title.children: Lehrmann's appeal over failed defamation case ends abruptly after two-day hearing

image.altText: A woman with curly hair and glasses smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: The university says it will save $60 million through salary reductions with $40 million to go. Its broader savings target is $250 million.

title.children: ANU rules out further forced redundancies

image.altText: A man walks our of a building, he is looking down and wearing a suit and a face mask.

props.synopsis: A jury sees a police interview with one of the two alleged victims of a former Canberra childcare worker accused of acts of indecency, in which the three-year-old said the man touched her "a lot".

title.children: Former childcare worker accused of indecently touching 3yo and 4yo

image.altText: A young man with medium length curly dark hair and glasses stands outdoors holding a guitar and looking serious.

props.synopsis: The Canberra Symphony Orchestra warns it could one day not have enough musicians to perform if proposed changes to the Australian National University go ahead, while prospective students say they're now considering studying interstate.

title.children: Ishan had wanted to study music at ANU. Now he's looking elsewhere

image.altText: Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: Lobbying has become big business, with around 727 lobbyists registered in the national capital, more than three times the number of elected officials sitting in parliament.

title.children: 'Revolving door' between politics and lobbying rings transparency alarm bell

image.altText: A woman in a fur coat in a selfie-style shot.

props.synopsis: Patients say long wait times for elective surgeries at public hospitals and the high cost of private hospital care are why they're heading overseas.

title.children: 'Meat on the chopping block': What patients say about medical tourism in China

image.altText: Tongan king Tupou VI wearing regal dress and his crown walks towards the camera during his coronation

props.synopsis: Tonga's king has taken control of a government department in what critics say is a 'slap' to democracy in the Pacific nation.

title.children: Tonga's king 'flexes his muscles' as critics fear 'dangerous' situation

image.altText: A confident-looking man in a suit and dark tie.

props.synopsis: The opposition will say Jim Chalmers hasn't been talking about the right things. The reform purists will say the big issues remain untackled.

title.children: A laundry basket of reform leaves a lot of washing to be done

image.altText: Izak Rankine, Josh Rachele and Darcy Fogarty walk off

props.synopsis: After a dream home and away season, adversity is officially on Adelaide's doorstep courtesy of Izak Rankine. How the club deals with this will define the current era under Matthew Nicks.

title.children: Rankine saga gives Adelaide its chance to grow from adversity in premiership hunt

image.altText: A woman smiles while waiving her hand in the air and wearing a 115th birthday tiara

props.synopsis: As British great-grandmother Ethel Caterham turns 116, research suggests extreme old age may be less about genes and more about paperwork.

title.children: A British researcher has uncovered the 'secret' to living to 110

image.altText: An ASX sign

props.synopsis: After crossing 9,000 points for the first time, the ASX 200 has dipped in early trade.Traders are bracing for an address by Jerome Powell to a central bank symposium. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX retreats from record as markets await Fed chair speech

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Guzman y Gomez shares take a tumble
Big swings on earnings, ASX 200 in the red
ASX on the flatline as trade begins

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking to the media in the White House Press Room.

props.synopsis: New York Attorney-General Letitia James says she will appeal the decision, which upheld the ruling that Mr Trump inflated his net worth but quashed the financial penalty set by a judge.

title.children: 'Total victory': Trump's $801 million civil fraud penalty thrown out by judge

image.altText: Woman outside staring off into the distance.

props.synopsis: Families are left in limbo as an organisation providing inclusive playgroups and support services is placed into liquidation in regional NSW, after operating for four decades.

title.children: Families shocked as NDIS-backed playgroup closes without warning

image.altText: Man with beard and unkept hair looking into camera for a mug shot.

props.synopsis: A former UK priest, who had "lycra nuns" looking after him, has been found guilty of sexually abusing nine women in the 80s and 90s.

title.children: Leader of 'cult-like' UK Christian group guilty of sexually abusing women

image.altText: a man on the beach in a car

props.synopsis: Backpackers in WA's north say they will pack up and leave if they are not allowed to cut loose at outdoor bush doof parties.

title.children: Backpackers threaten to leave Broome over 'bush doof' restrictions

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt and yellow hat looks away from the camera.

props.synopsis: Inspired by the diagnosis of his friends' baby, Mitch McKenny is running from Broken Hill to Newcastle to raise awareness and funds for people living with Angelman syndrome.

title.children: Broken Hill man aims to run 27 marathons in 29 days for rare syndrome

image.altText: A woman with tied back blond hair and tattooed arms sits down and holds a pole across her lap. She has a prosthetic leg

props.synopsis: A sporting career was never on the cards for Kirsty Maiden, but thanks to the South Australian Sport Institute's revolutionary Para Unit, she’s now poised to make her mark on the world stage.

title.children: Inside the elite sports unit forging Australia's next Paralympic stars

image.altText: womans silhouette from behind looking towards a window

props.synopsis: The Office of the Health Ombudsman (OHO) has filed disciplinary proceedings against the now-retired Brisbane doctor.

title.children: Doctor accused of performing 'excessive' breast checks and vaginal swabs

image.altText: Close-up of a car exhaust pipe and car exhaust smoke in an urban area.

props.synopsis: Vehicle emissions may contribute to more than 1,800 premature deaths in Australia each year, according to the nation's first assessment of the health impact of traffic-related pollution.

title.children: Car pollution is deadly. New research shows us just how much

image.altText: A man in a trucker cap and flannel shirt open over a T-shirt plays guitar on stage.

props.synopsis: Brent Hinds died after a car collided with his Harley-Davidson motorcycle in Atlanta late on Wednesday night.

title.children: Brent Hinds, former lead guitarist of heavy metal band Mastodon, has died

image.altText: A taxidermied wolf-like animal in a glass cabinet

props.synopsis: A lot happened this week. Did you take it all in?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A massive Qantas fine, a letter for Melania Trump and a taxidermy mystery

props.synopsis: At least five people are killed and dozens injured in a truck bombing on a military base in the Colombian city of Cali.

title.children: Five dead, dozens injured in Colombia air base attack

image.altText: David Flynn playing a piano.

props.synopsis: Perth doctor Raad Hassan is referred to health regulators after circumcision surgery led to the "devastating" and preventable death of toddler David Kalunga Flynn from a morphine overdose.

title.children: Morphine overdose from circumcision blamed for boy's 'devastating' death

image.altText: Two people wearing possum skins pass a traditional object between each other.

props.synopsis: In coming weeks the Victorian government is set to introduce a bill to legislate Australia's first formal treaty with traditional owners. The ABC can reveal it's expected to give Victoria's elected Aboriginal body powers to establish new institutions — like a proposed education institute.

title.children: New details emerge as Australia's first formal Treaty imminent in Victoria

image.altText: A shipping container being lifted by a gantry at a port.

props.synopsis: The deal will affect what both economies say is the "most valuable economic relationship in the world", worth $2.8 trillion each year.

title.children: US and EU release details of tariff deal, with European cars and wines hit

image.altText: A white truck, pursued by multiple police vehicles, drives on the wrong side of the road at night time.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian man has been refused bail after engaging Tasmania Police in an hours-long pursuit during which he drove a stolen truck through Launceston on blown-out tyres.

title.children: Slow-moving, hours-long police pursuit 'a bit Blues Brothers', witness says

image.altText: A young child stacks colourful Duplo blocks at a childcare centre. Other children stand next to them.

props.synopsis: A former early childhood teacher who has worked in several states and territories says she quit the profession after working in Western Australia.

title.children: 'Appalled and shocked': Early childhood teacher quit after working in WA

image.altText: A blonde woman holding a newborn baby girl dressed in pink

props.synopsis: Concerns are raised about the use of telehealth at regional hospitals, after a pregnant mother later diagnosed with pre-eclampsia is told to go home and "take Panadol with a can of Coke" in central Queensland.

title.children: Pregnant patient told to have Panadol at hospital with no doctor

image.altText: An anonymous woman, from the neck down, sitting on a children's bed, wearing a white sports jumper.

props.synopsis: After leaving a women's refuge, victim-survivor Maya felt "broken" and stigmatised while searching for a rental home. A new Western Sydney pilot project has changed her life completely.

title.children: 'The wrong picture': Victim-survivors stigmatised as not 'ideal' tenants

image.altText: APY Lands general manager Richard King.

props.synopsis: The APY Lands board has been ordered to remove general manager Richard King after a review commissioned by the state government concluded his reappointment was "a failure of proper accountable administration".

title.children: APY general manager's reappointment 'constitutionally invalid', report alleges

image.altText: A whale bursting through the surface of the ocean.

props.synopsis: It has been the most prolific year for southern right whale births on Australia's southern coastline in nearly a decade, according to researchers.

title.children: Bumper year for southern right whale births along Great Australian Bight
